messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: The Hunger Games is a story about a dangerous TV contest.
Teenagers fight, and only one lives.
It is in books and films.

One night in 2003, Suzanne Collins watched TV.
She changed channels again and again.
It was during a war.
The US army went into Iraq then.
She saw TV shows about real people.
They tried to win one million dollars.
She also saw news about the war.
In her mind, the two things mixed.
It felt very wrong to her.
Then she got the idea for The Hunger Games.

metadata.feedback_text:
FAIL: Factual Inaccuracy. The Writer’s Output adds information not in the original text:
- “The Hunger Games is a story about a dangerous TV contest.” This sentence does not appear in the original text.
- “Teenagers fight, and only one lives.” This detail is not mentioned in the original.
- “It is in books and films.” The original does not state this.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: One night in 2003, Suzanne Collins watched TV.
She changed channels again and again.
It was during a war.
The US army went into Iraq then.
She saw TV shows with young people.
They tried to win one million dollars.
She also saw news about the war.
In her mind, the two things mixed.
It felt very wrong to her.
Then she got the idea for The Hunger Games.
The Hunger Games is the name of that idea.

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: A2 Vocabulary Violation. The text contains the B1 word "Hunger" in the title "The Hunger Games". A2 level vocabulary does not include the word "hunger". To correct this, replace or define the term at A2 level. Suggestion: Change the title reference to a simpler phrase or add a simple explanation for "hunger" such as "feeling very hungry".
